intro: Yakirra muelleri, commonly known as the slender rock heath, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Ericaceae and is characterized by its low-growing, shrub-like structure. The plant features small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or white in color. Yakirra muelleri thrives in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid regions. It is adapted to withstand drought and poor soil conditions, making it a resilient species in its native habitat.
